snippet: With Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg to leave office at year’s end, there is concern that the city’s next leader will end a period of bike-friendly programs and policies.
abstract: Cyclists in New York City are concerned that city's next mayor will end departing Mayor Michael R Bloomberg's bike-friendly programs and policies; in early stages of campaign for mayor, candidates have expressed little enthusiasm about expansion of bike lanes, and a few have made comments that suggest they may seek to erase some of them.
lead_paragraph: With Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg to leave office at year’s end, there is concern that the city’s next leader will end a period of bike-friendly programs and policies.

headline.seo: New York Bike-Lane Advocates Fear New Mayor Will Roll Back Gains
headline.main: Anxiety Over Future of Bike Lanes
headline.print_headline: Anxiety Over Future of Bike Lanes
